newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: CS, UBS cut cash bond rates.
newsitem.headline: CS, UBS cut cash bond rates.

text.p: Union Bank of Switzerland and Credit Suisse, in separate announcements, said they were cutting the rates paid on some cash bonds (kassenobligationen) by one-quarter percentage point.
The rates announced by both banks become effective on September 11.

Credit Suisse said the new rate on two-year bonds was lowered to 2-1/2 percent. Rates on four-, five-, six-, and seven-year bonds will be 3-1/4, 3-1/2, 3-3/4 and four percent, respectively. Rates on three year bonds and on eight year bonds were unchanged at 3.0 percent and 4-1/4 percent, respectively.
Union Bank of Switzerland lowered rates on four- to seven-year bonds by one-quarter points to 3-1/4 percent, 3-1/2 percent, 3-3/4 percent and 4.0 percent, respectively.
Rates on two-, three- and eight-year bonds were unchanged at 2-1/2, 3.0 and 4-1/4 percent, respectively. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
